quotes.quote: All judgment reveals itself to be self-judgment in the end, and when this is understood a larger comprehension of the nature of life takes its place.
Do not judge, and you will never be mistaken.
Judgment is forced upon us by experience
Good judgment is what you get from experience, which is what you have immediately after using poor judgement.
Judgment means that you view the world as you are, rather than as it is.
Sometimes it seems safer to hold it all in, where the only person who can judge is yourself.
One cool judgment is worth a thousand hasty counsels. The thing to do is to supply light and not heat.
Feeling without judgment is a washy draught indeed; but judgment untempered by feeling is too bitter and husky a morsel for human deglutition.
Judgment is contained in the act of trying to understand.
In the lack of judgment great harm arises, but one vote cast can set right a house.
Our judgments, like our watches, none go just alike, yet each believes his ownâ€
Outward judgment often fails, inward judgment never.
Judgment of the people in the situation is not helpful. How can you help them is the question.
A hasty judgment is a first step to recantation.
A negative judgment gives you more satisfaction than praise, provided it smacks of jealousy.
Collective judgment of new ideas is so often wrong that it is arguable that progress depends on individuals being free to back their own judgment despite collective disapproval.

What judgment I had increases rather than diminishes; and thoughts, such as they are, come crowding in so fast upon me, that my only difficulty is to choose or reject; to run them into verse or to give them the other harmony of prose.
Good judgment comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgment.
Judgement is a buzz activity that allows one to form his or her own opinion. People see and hear through the lens of their beliefs, perceptions and phantasms only.
Good judgment comes from experience, and experience well, that comes from poor judgment.
A judgment about life has no meaning except the truth of the one who speaks last, and the mind is at ease only at the moment when everyone is shouting at once and no one can hear a thing.
A representative owes not just his industry but his judgement.
Value judgments are destructive to our proper business, which is curiosity and awareness.
Every judgment in science stands on the edge of error, and is personal.
Sound judgment, with discernment, is the best of seers.
A reputation for good judgment, for fair dealing, for truth, and for rectitude, is itself a fortune.
Judgment consists not in seeing through deceptions and evil intentions, but in being able to awaken the decency dormant in every person.
We should use our judgment before coming to a decision.
A right judgment draws us a profit from all things we see.
Good judgment comes from experience, and a lot of that comes from bad judgment.
Judgment and weariness are foes to service and generosity.
Judgment traps you within the limitations of your comparisons. It inhibits freedom.
Fortune is for all, judgment is theirs who have won it for themselves.
Common sense is judgment without reflection, shared by an entire class, an entire nation, or the entire human race.
Judgment is guilt wearing a moral mask to disguise its pain.
For all right judgment of any man or things it is useful, nay, essential, to see his good qualities before pronouncing on his bad.
We know so little. Our judgment is so limited. We judge the Lord's ways from our own narrow view.
Nothing strengthens the judgment and quickens the conscience like individual responsibility.
Make your judgment trustworthy by trusting it
All general judgments are loose and imperfect
A mistake in judgment isn't fatal, but too much anxiety about judgment is.
Judgment is one of the ego's tools to foster separation through comparison.
Judgement is often no more than a confession of ignorance.
Knowledge is the treasure, but judgment is the treasurer of a wise man.
Moral judgment is not life-giving; love that transcends the boundaries of judgment as Jesus' love did, is.
Never look down on anybody unless you're helping him up.
Judge not before you judge yourself. Judge not if you're not ready for judgment.
It is only shallow people who do not judge by appearances
The judgment of the intellect is, at best, only the half of truth.
Judgment is judgment, whether you're obese, or too skinny, or not athletic enough.
